newsitem.title: GERMANY: German MUM shares offered at 38-45 dmk.
newsitem.headline: German MUM shares offered at 38-45 dmk.

text.p: Shares in Germany software group Mensch und Maschine AG will be offered to investors in a book-building process at a price of between 38 and 45 marks, DG Bank, as arranger for the issue, said.
DG Bank board member Uwe Flach said the minimum subscription volume was 150 shares. The subscription period would run from July 16 to July 18.
The issue price will be announced on July 19 with shares being listed on Germany's New Market from July 21.
The company's basic capital is being raised to a nominal value of 9.5 million marks from 8.2 million marks with the issue of five-mark nominal value shares.
Adi Drotleff and his family will retain majority ownership after the bourse listing, holding 70 percent of the stock.
Bayerische Vereinsbank and Heinrich Gontard and Co are co-leaders of the consortium group.
